events.name: GDG-Hubli : Build your first Action on Google

venue.name: K. L. E. Institute of Technology

events.description:
Finally, Google Developers Group has a chapter in our very own Hubli. Come to learn, develop and meet like-minded people this Saturday on the 15th of Sept.

Learn to build apps for Google Assistant fellow organizers and take back new friends and pools of knowledge!!

Know more about Actions on Google here : https://developers.google.com/actions/

RSVP here on meetup page also please do fill this form : https://goo.gl/forms/8KBGos9ROzOPbQNK2

See you there!!

events.name: Development 101 with GDG-Hubli

venue.name: J S S Shri Manjunatheshwara Institute Of UG. & PG. Studies

events.description:
Want to know everything about developing an application/website to deploying it on a cloud? Then this event is for you. Attend the hands-on workshop conducted by GDG-Hubli team to learn whatâ€™s up with full-stack, from git basics till the last deploy, get to know what it takes, all on Google platform

This workshop is focused on people who are just getting started with development. Be it mobile or web. There is a lot more to building software than just coding. Starting with a basic idea, using different tools/technologies to make your development flow as smooth as possible to your coding styles.

All Google technologies involved in building the same will be introduced. Also, an overview of what a developer must be aware of in the coming years, the budding technologies he/she must know and learn to be a recognized developer/to land the perfect job will be informed.

The hands-on contents of the workshop are mentioned below:
* Building a web-based application
* Version control of the application using GIT.
* Introduction to SSH, Package manager and usage of a terminal.
* Hosting of the application on Google Cloud Platform / Firebase.
* Exploring some products of Google with examples

In addition to this, the workshop will cover
-> Need of the hour technologies.
-> Developer culture and best practices.
-> Types of jobs in this domain and things to be done to get your desired
job profile.
-> All important Google technologies you can exploit.

What will you need?
1. An open mind eager to learn.
2. A computer/laptop, as this is a hands-on workshop.
3. A verified google cloud account

To save time, we recommend having the following software installed :
1. Visual Studio Code - editor/ Sublime text editor
2. Git
3. A verified account on Google could platform
4. A Github account
5. A web browser.

events.name: Version control & Intro to Github
events.description:
In this meetup, you will be introduced to the concept of Version control and how it is used in the world of software development, understand the advantages of using version control. How can it be used in other areas than Software development? We will be exploring various platforms like Github, Gitlab, Bitbucket but use Github for most of the time.

This is focused on Beginner developers. Feel free to join in if you are in development.

This will be a hands-on event. So, bring your laptops with Git software installed in it. So that you will not be wasting time installing it on the day of the event.

Location: Clite building, KLE Technological University ( Previously known as BVB Hubli )
Google maps pin : https://www.google.com/maps/place/CLITE/@15.3703973,75.1210623,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x3bb8d0ccc4c00001:0xac2a538aff37f28e!8m2!3d15.3703921!4d75.123251

events.name: WTM Get together and Study Jam on Web technologies

venue.name: K. L. E. Institute of Technology

events.description: On the account of International Women's Day, GDG-Hubli and Women Techmakers Hubli is hosting this event. Come listen to inspiring stories about Women excelling in the world and know more about their journey. Also, a study jam on Basics of Web technologies is planned on the same day. Learn about using HTML,CSS and Javascript to create interesting applications quickly.

events.name: Open source day

venue.name: Jellycone
venue.address_1: KLE Technological - BVB College of Engineering and Technology, Vidyanagar, Hubli

events.description:
Let us take a day off to contribute to open source projects. We all know the value of open source projects. The current state of software/hardware development would not be possible without opensource projects.

This is a beginner friendly event. Even if you have not contributed to any open source projects before. You will be introduced to the code of conducts that projects follow and teach you how to contribute.

That being said it's better if you already have practical knowledge of building software. Anything from HTML, css, js, react, vue, c, c++, java, ruby, PHP, Android, nodejs, sass, etc.. But even if you don't have any experience on that part but would like to attend you are more than welcome.

Please don't forget to bring your laptops and preferably mobile hotspots so as to not to depend on the venue's wifi.

Software and prerequisites,
Basically, you will be needing git software installed. Apart from that if you know what you are contributing to, set up related to that project would be necessary. If you are planning to hop on a new project/issue. Come with just git installed on your machine.

Do leave a comment if you have any questions

Thanks to Jellycone for letting us use their space. Do check them out here -> https://www.jellycone.com
events.how_to_find_us: You will get direct buses to KLE university (BVB College of engineering) Vidya nagar, Take left on the campus entry and look for R.H.Kulkarni building / LHC.

group_profile.intro: I am a full stack developer and avid maker. Love for the community, electronics, guns and learning new stuff. Currently I work at Hashnode, on free time work on Certhive and few mini projects.
